greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of P-positions in the game of Nim with up to four piles, allowing for piles of zero, such that the total number of objects in all piles is 2n.
link: T. Khovanova and J. Xiong, Nim Fractals, arXiv:1405.594291 [math.CO] (2014), p. 16 and J. Int. Seq. 17 (2014) # 14.7.8.
example: The P-positions with the total of 4 are permutations of (0,0,2,2) and (1,1,1,1). Therefore, a(2)=7.
mathematica: Table[{n, k, j, BitXor[n, k, j]}, {n, 0, a}, {k, 0, a}, {j, 0,
results.author: _Tanya Khovanova_ and _Joshua Xiong_, May 02 2014
